name: Noseong Park
content: BigDyL in WISESearch this siteEmbedded FilesSkip to main contentSkip to navigationThe Laboratory of Big Data Analytics and Learning (BigDyL pronounced as Big Deal) in Web, Industrial, and Scientific Environments (WISE), was established in March 2020 at Yonsei University and moved to KAIST in February 2024. We are now studying the following problems (listed in alphabetical order):Deep Generative Models,Differential Equation-based Deep Learning,Graph Convolutional Networks,Recommendation (Collaborative Filtering and Sequential Recommendation),Scientific Foundation Model, Physics-informed Neural Network, and Operator Learning,Tabular Data Synthesis, and Representation Learning,Time Series/Spatiotemporal Synthesis, Forecasting, and Anomaly Detection.ğŸ“° NewsğŸ‰ Our codes and data can be found in https://github.com/bigdyl-kaist.(November 8, 2025) Two papers (one oral and one poster) were accepted in AAAI Conference on Artificial Intelligence (AAAI) 2026.(October 23, 2025) One paper was accepted in IEEE International Conference on Big Data (IEEE BigData) 2025.(September paper was accepted in International Joint Conference on Artificial Intelligence (IJCAI) 2025.(March 10, 2025) A project, titled "LLM-driven Chain-of-Thought Analysis for Tabular Data," will be supported by Microsoft Research Asia, and Yehjin Shin will visit Microsoft Research Asia in Beijing for her internship.(March 6, 2025) Three papers were accepted in Workshops at International Conference on Learning Representations (ICLR) 2025. In total, BigDyL at KAIST has three main conference papers and three workshop papers at ICLR 2025.(February 5, 2025) One journal paper was accepted in Results in Applied Mathematics (IF=1.4).(January 23, 2025) Three papers were accepted in International Conference on Learning Representations (ICLR) 2025.(December 19, 2024) Two papers were accepted in Workshops at AAAI Conference on Artificial Intelligence (AAAI) 2025. In total, BigDyL at KAIST has one AAAI main conference paper and two AAAI workshop papers.(December 10, 2024) One paper was accepted in AAAI Conference on Artificial Intelligence (AAAI) 2025.(October 29, 2024) One journal paper was published in Advanced Intelligent Systems (IF=7.4).(October 24, 2024) One paper was accepted in ACM International Web Search and Data Mining Conference (WSDM) 2025.(October 11, 2024) ì‚¼ì„±ë¯¸ë˜ê¸°ìˆ ìœ¡ì„±ì„¼í„°ë¡œë¶€í„° Scientific Foundation Model ì—°êµ¬ ì œì•ˆì´ ì„ ì • ë˜ì—ˆìŠµë‹ˆë‹¤. ë…¸ë²¨ í™”í•™ìƒì˜ ì˜ì˜ˆë¥¼ ì•ˆê²¨ì¤€ ì•ŒíŒŒí´ë“œëŠ” ì¸ë¥˜ê°€ ì§€ë‚œ ìˆ˜ë°± ë…„ ê°„ ë°íŒ ë‹¨ë°±ì§ˆ 3ì°¨ì› êµ¬ì¡° ë³´ë‹¤ í›¨ì”¬ ë” ë§ì€ ìˆ˜ë¥¼ ë‹¨ì‹œê°„ì— ë°í˜”ìŠµë‹ˆë‹¤. ë˜, ë…¸ë²¨ ë¬¼ë¦¬í•™ìƒì´ ë¨¸ì‹ ëŸ¬ë‹ì˜ ì´ˆì°½ê¸° ìƒì„±ëª¨ë¸ ì—°êµ¬ìë“¤ì—ê²Œ ëŒì•„ê°„ ê²ƒì€ ì¸ê³µì§€ëŠ¥ê³¼ í†µê³„ë¬¼ë¦¬í•™ì˜ ê¹Šì€ ì—°ê´€ì„±ì„ ë³´ì¸ë‹¤ê³  ë³¼ ìˆ˜ ìˆìŠµë‹ˆë‹¤. ê´€ë ¨í•˜ì—¬ ì•„ì§ í•´ê²° ë˜ì§€ ëª»í•œ ë¬¸ì œê°€ ë¬¼ë¦¬/í™”í•™/ê³µí•™/ì‚¬íšŒê³¼í•™/ê²½ì œí•™ ë“±ì—ì„œ í˜„ìƒì„ ì„¤ëª…í•˜ëŠ” í¸ë¯¸ë¶„ë°©ì •ì‹(ë‚˜ë¹„ì—-ìŠ¤í† í¬ìŠ¤ ë°©ì •ì‹, ë§¥ìŠ¤ì›° ë°©ì •ì‹ ë“±)ì„ í­ ë„“ê³  ë¹ ë¥´ê²Œ í•´ì„í•˜ëŠ” ê²ƒ ì…ë‹ˆë‹¤. ì„ ì •ëœ ì—°êµ¬ëŠ” ì´ì— ë„ì „í•©ë‹ˆë‹¤.(October 11, 2024) One paper was accepted in NeurIPS 2024 WorkshopFM4Science.(September 26, 2024) One paper was accepted in Annual Conference on Neural Information Processing Systems (NeurIPS) 2024.(July 16, 2024) Two papers were accepted in ACM International Conference on Information and Knowledge Management (CIKM) 2024.(June 29, 2024) Prof. Noseong Park will serve as the General Chair for the 34th ACM International Conference on Information and Knowledge Management (CIKM), a top-tier conference for recommender systems, information retrieval, and big data management, which will be held in South Korea at 2025.(June 7, 2024) Jinsung Jeon successfully defended his Ph.D. thesis. He will join UCSD for this postdoctoral study. Best wishes for all his future endeavors!Â (June 7, 2024) Our paper, titled "Parameterized Physics-informed Neural Networks for Parameterized PDEs," was selected for its oral presentation in ICML 2024. This year the oral acceptance rate is 1.5%.(May 17, 2024) One paper was accepted in ACM SIGKDD Conference on Knowledge Discovery and Data Mining (KDD) 2024.(May 7, 2024) Prof. Noseong Park will chair the tutorial session of the 18th ACM International Web Search and Data Mining Conference (WSDM).(May 2, 2024) Four papers were accepted in International Conference on Machine Learning (ICML) 2024.(April 17, 2024) One paper, titled "SVD-AE: Simple Autoencoders for Collaborative Filtering," was accepted in International Joint Conference on Artificial Intelligence (IJCAI) 2024.(March 4, 2024) Two papers, titled "Extension of Physics-informed Neural Networks to Solving Parameterized PDEs," and "SPI-GAN: Denoising Diffusion GANs with Straight-Path Interpolations," were accepted in ICLR Workshop 2024.(February 1, 2024) BigDyL in WISE moved to the School of Computing in KAIST, Daejeon. Prof. Noseong Park was appointed as a tenured associate professor at KAIST. [ë³´ë„ìë£Œ](December 9, 2023) Two papers, titled "Operator-learning-inspired Modeling of Neural Ordinary Differential Equations," and "An Attentive Inductive Bias for Sequential Recommendation beyond the Self-Attention," were accepted in AAAI Conference on Artificial Intelligence (AAAI) 2024.(October 29, 2023) One paper, titled "Long-term Time Series Forecasting based on Decomposition and Neural Ordinary Differential Equations," was accepted in IEEE International Conference on Big Data (IEEE BigData) 2023.(October 28, 2023) One paper, titled "HyperNetwork Approximating Future Parameters for Time Series Forecasting under Temporal Drifts," was accepted in NeurIPS Workshop on Distribution Shifts (DistShift) 2023.(October 20, 2023) One paper, titled "Continuous-time Autoencoders for Regular and Irregular Time Series Imputation," was accepted in ACM International Web Search and Data Mining Conference (WSDM) 2024 for its oral presentation.(October 7, 2023) ğŸ‰The paper of TableGAN, which is a pioneering work in tabular data synthesis, is now the most cited among all VLDB papers published within the last 5 years.One paper, titled "Hypernetwork-based Meta-Learning for Low-Rank Physics-Informed Neural Networks," was accepted in Annual Conference on Neural Information Processing Systems (NeurIPS) 2023 for its spotlight presentation. [arXiv&GitHub]One paper, titled "MadSGM: Multivariate Anomaly Detection with Score-based Generative Models," was accepted in the ACM International Conference on Information and Knowledge Management (CIKM) 2023.One paper, titled "Precursor-of-Anomaly Detection for Irregular Time Series," was accepted in ACM SIGKDD Conference on Knowledge Discovery and Data Mining (KDD) 2023.Prof. Noseong Park was invited to present GREAD, a recent ICML paper, on June 27th for SEA-CROGS (https://www.pnnl.gov/projects/sea-crogs) where Sandia National Labs and Pacific Northwest National Labs are collaborating to solve scientific problems with deep learning. [Webinar Schedule]One paper, titled "Self-Attention LSTM-FCN Model for Arrhythmia Classification and Uncertainty Assessment," was accepted in Artificial Intelligence In Medicine (IF=7.011).Â Two papers, titled "GREAD: Graph Neural Reaction-Diffusion Networks," and "CoDi: Co-evolving Contrastive Diffusion Models for Mixed-type Tabular Synthesis," were accepted in International Conference on Machine Learning (ICML) 2023. [arXiv&GitHub of GREAD] [arXiv&GitHub of CoDi]One paper, titled "Hawkes Process based on Controlled Differential Equations," was accepted in International Joint Conference on Artificial Intelligence (IJCAI) 2023.One paper, titled "Blurring-Sharpening Process Models for Collaborative Filtering," was accepted in International ACM SIGIR Conference on Research and Development in Information Retrieval (SIGIR) 2023. [arXiv&GitHub]Seoyoung Hong won the best student paper award at IEEE BigData 2022 for her paper titled "TimeKit: A Time-series Forecasting-based Upgrade Kit for Collaborative Filtering." IEEE BigData ranked right after ICDM is one of the major conferences in the field of data mining & analysis.
